content: I am trying to figure out if I should start planning to join the national guard and the only question I have left is if my vision does or doesn't meet the requirements to join. My corrected vision is 20/20 in my right and 20/60 in my left. My specialty will probably be combat arms. Could someone please tell me if I am eligible for that and if not am I eligible for any of the other specalities? Thanks
reply: I am trying to figure out if I should start planning to join the national guard and the only question I have left is if my vision does or doesn't meet the requirements to join. title: Vision Requirments of National Guard?

content: Why the big difference and which one would you shoot with? 20/60 is kinda out there for operating equipment and firing weapons accurately - - Wandering and Wondering

title: Vision Requirments of National Guard?

content: Well, obviously good eyesight is a major player in safety and ability to function in the military, especially the combat arms, including good peripheral vision. Certainly there are administrative functions, mechanic and other technical jobs that probably would not be as dependent on good, clear vision in both eyes. Maybe that might be the way to go. Besides, mechanic, electrician, computer, or machinist skills of some kind would be a lot more in demand in the civilian world later than rifleman, unless you plan to live along the Mexico/Arizona border - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Well, obviously good eyesight is a major player in safety and ability to function in the military, especially the combat arms, including good peripheral vision. Certainly there are administrative functions, mechanic and other technical jobs that probably would not be as dependent on good, clear vision in both eyes. Maybe that might be the way to go. Besides, mechanic, electrician, computer, or machinist skills of some kind would be a lot more in demand in the civilian world later than rifleman, unless you plan to live along the Mexico/Arizona border - - Wandering and Wondering

content: If you are checking your eyesight for enlistment, check for colorblind. That may limit your possibilities also.
